subject: Self Care
title: Perspective Beyond Your Bubble
description: A micro-lesson that makes Perspective Beyond Your Bubble usable.

hook.text: You think your view is obvious. Then someone from a different background explains the opposite â€” and it makes sense.

buildup.text: The false consensus effect makes us assume most people share our beliefs. They don't. And that's valuable.

discovery.text: Exposure to different cultures, classes, and worldviews literally expands the brain's empathy circuits.

twist.text: Disagreement isn't a sign of ignorance. It's often a sign of different but equally valid experiences.

climax.text: Seek out perspectives that challenge yours. Read, travel, or simply ask: 'How do you see it differently?'

punchline.text: Expand your bubble. Empathy grows with exposure.

quiz.question: What is the false consensus effect?
options: Believing your opinion is always wrong
Assuming most people share your beliefs when they don't
